raw_comment:
Notice: I noticed that from 50th-70th, the without legacy applicants rate decreased but the legacy applicants increased. 

Wonder: I wonder how this would vary from school to school. For example, Is one school much more likely to value legacy applicants than those without legacy status, or vice versa? 

Relation to Community: This relates to my community because as high school students, we need to be aware of data like this during our application processes so we know what our probabilities are and what odds may be stacked against or in favor of us. 

Headline: “Legacy Privileges Unveiled. Are The Odds in Your Favor?”
ace_sentences: I noticed a trend from the 50th percentile to the 70th percentile.
In this range, the rate of applicants without legacy status decreased.
In this range, the rate of legacy applicants increased.
I wonder how this trend varies from school to school.
One school may value legacy applicants more than applicants without legacy status.
Another school may value applicants without legacy status more than legacy applicants.
This topic relates to my community.
High school students apply to schools.
High school students need to be aware of data like this during the application process.
If a student is aware of this data, then the student can estimate the student's probability of admission.
If a student is aware of this data, then the student can estimate what odds are stacked against the student.
If a student is aware of this data, then the student can estimate what odds are stacked in favor of the student.
The headline is: "Are the odds in your favor?"
